brief.content-text:
The diagram depicts the functions of the Applications Layer protocols, which provide the rules for communication between applications. Two O S I models are interconnected at the Application Layer by a text block with the word "Protocols". At the Physical Layer of each O S I model is a switch that connects to a router. The two routers are interconnected by a WAN link.

Functions performed by protocols include:
- Define processes on either end of the communication.
- Define the types of messages.
- Define the syntax of messages.
- Define the meaning of any informational fields.
- Define how messages are sent and the expected response.
- Define interaction with the next lower layer.
